global.status: Active means control must be implemented for compliance. Inactive means the control is in use.

policy.primary: The contact who is responsible for the policy development and revisions.
policy.additional: Additional collaborators to support the policy development and revisions.
policy.audience: Audience can see policy after the document is published.

internalControl.controlStrength: Specify the expected control effectiveness by management. 0 for no effectiveness required and 100 for absolute effectiveness. Monitor your issues to measure actual effectiveness.
internalControl.keyControl: Key controls are meant to reduce the chances of a risk happening as opposed to a none key control (or compensating controls) where specific requirements for compliance can't be met with an existing controls. The former is permanent; the latter is temporary.
internalControl.assets:
Internal control is applied to the assets listed. This provides context for evidence collection.

If Gray color chip, then the Asset is from manual input or both.

If Orange color chip, then then Asset is from Evidence > Asset.
internalControl.type: Manual controls rely on human actions. Automated controls rely on technology actions.

asset.assetRisk: Average residual risk score from the related risk register.
asset.control: The average control strength from related internal controls.
asset.issues: Managed is total findings where status is opened with risk mitigation record. Unmanaged is total findings where status is expired or without risk mitigation record. Closed is total finding where status is closed.
asset.downstreamLinks: This record is related to the selected assets.
asset.heat_map: This heat map is the impact (inherent risk) and probability for each related risk register representation for this asset.
asset.risk_mitigation: This chart shows all risk mitigation status excluding archived plans. Each finding can have multiple risk mitigation however, only the latest plan is active.

user.manager: The assigned manager will received escalation alerts related to this user.
user.role: Administrator has access to all features, data, and elevated access. Manager has access to all features, data, and manage approvals without the elevated access. General user has access to records they are assigned to managed or approve. Vendor user has access to records they are assigned to managed who is external to the company. Read-Only has access to view all records.
user.type: Internal users are working on behalf of the company. e.g. Employees, Interns, or Contractors. External users are not a part of the company. e.g. Vendors

riskRegister.riskGroup: Define the risk category groups for risk reporting.
riskRegister.asset: List of asset this risk may impact.
riskRegister.inherentRiskScore: If inherent risk is automated, the inherent risk is the highest asset impact value, otherwise it is the manual input value.
riskRegister.probability: The probability for the risk to occur is based on the internal control(s). If residual risk is 0, then the probability is also 0. If the residual risk is greater than 0, then the probability is 100 minus the average control strength.
riskRegister.riskTreatment: Accept - No action need. If issues is detected, track and monitor the issue. Avoid - Do not introduce this risk to the organization. If issues is detected, track and monitor the issue. Transfer - Pass on this risk to another responsibility organization. If issues is detected, track and monitor the issue. e.g. Buy insurance. Mitigate - Take action to mitigate this risk.
riskRegister.controlsWidget: Average control strength from related Internal Controls.
riskRegister.heat_map: This heat map is the impact (inherent risk) and probability for each related asset related to this risk register.
riskRegister.inherentImpact: If inherent risk is automated, the inherent impact is the highest asset impact value, otherwise it is the manual input value.
riskRegister.inherentLikehood: If inherent risk is automated, the inherent likelihood is the average control strength, otherwise it is the manual input value.

finding.riskTreatment: Accept - No action need. If issues is detected, track and monitor the issue. Avoid - Do not introduce this risk to the organization. If issues is detected, track and monitor the issue. Transfer - Pass on this risk to another responsibility organization. If issues is detected, track and monitor the issue. e.g. Buy insurance. Mitigate - Take action to mitigate this risk.

riskMitigation.actionPlan: Describe the mitigation plan to reduce the risk.
riskMitigation.expectedCompletionDate: Provide an estimate when this action plan will be resolved. If the date is past the finding due date SLA, obtain approval for the plans before proceeding.

assessment.riskScoreWidget: Risk Score formula is (Answer Score / Max Risk Score ) * 100.
assessment.maxScore: Max score is the maximum score risk score for the assessment. Risk score is calculated from LIST or CHECKBOX question type. 1. If List question type, for each question, use the highest risk score from the listvalue. 2. If Checkbox type, for each question, sum the risk score from the listvalues.

helpText.riskScoreWidget: Avg (last assessments)+ Finding Score from vendor and related engagements
helpText.findings: Findings from Vendor and related engagements and assessments
helpText.risk_score_is_determined: The risk score is determined by Average latest assessments risk score from vendor and related engagements plus the Finding Score. The risk rating is determined by the Risk Policy for the asset type.

APITokenInfoSection.text1: API token is a secret key used for integration and automated jobs. It is activated when the user status is active. When a new key is created, it will provide the role assigned for the user. A user can only have one token at a time.
APITokenInfoSection.text2: During key rotation, the old key will be in pending status. This key will be active for maximum 5 days. The pending key will terminate automatically when the new key is used. For more information about the CyberOne Risk API, see the API documentation.
APITokenInfoSection.text3: You can test the API with your browser (enter your token as the username with no password), or paste the following curl command into your terminal:

dasboard_task_description_enum.submit_document_request: #id is assigned to you by #owner. Click to submit your evidence by due date #due_date.
dasboard_task_description_enum.resubmit_document_request: #id approval request is rejected. Click to view the reviewer’s comment and re-submit your Document Request.
dasboard_task_description_enum.submit_evidence: #id is past due. Click to submit your evidence to avoid further escalation.
dasboard_task_description_enum.submit_assessment_answer: #id is assigned to you by #owner. The Assessment Answer are due by #due_date. Click to submit the Assessment Answer.
dasboard_task_description_enum.submit_overdue_assessment_answer: #id is past due. The Assessment Answer is due by #due_date. Click to submit the Assessment Answer.
dasboard_task_description_enum.resbumit_assessment_answer: #id approval request is rejected. Click to view the reviewer’s comment and re-submit your Assessment Answer.
dasboard_task_description_enum.submit_risk_mitigation: #owner created #id. Request to submit risk mitigation plan.
dasboard_task_description_enum.submit_overdue_risk_mitigation: #id is assigned to you and is past due. Please submit your risk mitigation plan to avoid further escalation.
dasboard_task_description_enum.resubmit_risk_mitigation: #id is re-opened because approval request for the Risk Mitigation is rejected. Submit a new risk mitigation plan.
dasboard_task_description_enum.submit_overdue_risk_mitigation_resolutio: #id is past due for resolution. Submit the resolution or add a new plan.
dasboard_task_description_enum.approval_request: #id is submitted for review by #owner. Click to Approve or Reject.
dasboard_task_description_enum.default: #id is assigned to you by #owner. Click to view.

section1.title: Internal Control Linked
section1.help_text: At least one internal control is linked to this requirement.

section2.title: Evidence Linked
section2.help_text: Evidence is linked to all related internal controls.

section3.title: Document Request Submitted
section3.help_text: The document request is submitted, submitted for approval, or approved for the audit period. The system will evaluate document requests for all periods if the audit period is not specified.

section4.title: Implementation Status
section4.help_text: 1) Fully Implemented - If internal control, evidence, and document request are submitted for the audit period. 2.) Partially Implemented - If internal control and some evidence or some document request are submitted for the audit period. 3). Not Implemented - If the control library does not have internal control linked.
